Luciano Regulus has written a book about Queen Marie-José, née Princess Marie-José of Belgium. The book focuses on Marie-José's role against fascism. According to Noblesse & Royautes, Luciano Regulus has also written a detailed biography about the Italian Queen:

Entretien avec Luciano Regolo, auteur d’un livre sur la reine Marie José d’Italie | Noblesse & Royautés

After the marriage ceremony they were received by the Pope in the Vatican.

Are there any videos or pictures of the wedding ceremony?

Any information, much appreciated!

Country

I am trying to find out who officiated the wedding ceremony between Maria Jose' and Umberto II in Rome on January, 8th 1930.

Are there any videos or pictures of the wedding ceremony?

Any information, much appreciated!

Their wedding was officiated by Cardinal Pietro Maffi, Archbishop of Pisa.

Originally the wedding was planned to be celebrated by Cardinal Giuseppe Gamba, Archbishop of Torino, whom Umberto was very fond of; unfortunately, Cardinal Gamba died a couple of weeks before the date planned for the wedding. Then it was Pope Pius XI who chose Cardinal Maffi to replace him.

Seeing these videos I ask how the monarchy fell? I think it's weird. The Kings were popular, from what I've seen in the videos.

JR76

Heir Apparent

Joined

Jan 8, 2012

Messages

4,841

City

Malmö

Country

Seeing these videos I ask how the monarchy fell? I think it's weird. The Kings were popular, from what I've seen in the videos.

The way I've understood it the main reasons was Victor Emmanuel's refusal to abdicate in time before the referendum to make it possible for his son to save the monarchy by having enough time to distance it from the fascist regime, while southern Italy had been liberated for a substantial time before the referendum and had allowed Umberto & Maria Jose opportunities to endear themselves to the population there in the north their opposition to the fascist regime was practically unknown and finally the referendum was flawed and performed in a country still in chaos and with large parts of the electorate unaccounted for.

Last edited: May 7, 2018

King Umberto, Queen Maria José and the Formula 1 in Naples.

The Posillipo circuit changed its name several times. The prestige of the Neapolitan track convinces Prince Umberto di Savoia to dedicate it to his wife, renaming the competition that was held here "Coppa Principessa di Piemonte":

https://internapoli.it/napoli-circuito-formula-1-posillipo/
